Asymmetric Mobility Intro

Source: ../vignettes/asymmetric_mobility_intro.Rmd
asymmetric_mobility_intro.Rmd
library(spread)
#> spread 2023.1.24
#> https://docs.sykdomspulsen.no/spread

Required data

The initial values for all geographic locations.

spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_seiiar_pop
#>    location_code    S E  I Ia R
#> 1:             a 1000 0 50  0 0
#> 2:             b 1000 0  0  0 0
#> 3:             c 2000 0  0  0 0

A list containing 1 mobility matrix per time period (4 time periods per day, 5 days = 20 time periods).

The mobility matrix must contain all non-diagonal links (i.e. every geographical location combination must be included, except for people “staying at home”)

length(spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_mobility_matrix)
#> [1] 20
spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_mobility_matrix[[1]]
#>    from to  n
#> 1:    a  b 50
#> 2:    a  c 10
#> 3:    b  a 10
#> 4:    b  c 10
#> 5:    c  a 10
#> 6:    c  b 10

One beta per time period.

spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_betas
#>  [1] 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6
#> [20] 0.6

Example 

d <- spread::asymmetric_mobility(
  seiiar_pop = spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_seiiar_pop,
  mobility_matrix = spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_mobility_matrix,
  betas = spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_betas,
  latent_period = 1.9,
  infectious_period = 3.0,
  asymptomatic_prob = 0,
  asymptomatic_relative_infectiousness = 0,
  N = 1
)

b_* variables represent the status of people belonging to a particular geographical location.

c_* variables represent the current status of all the people existing in that geographical location at that time point.

print(d)
#>     location_code week day  time  b_S b_E b_I b_Ia b_R  c_S c_E c_I c_Ia c_R
#>  1:             a    1   1 23:59  981  16  38    0  15  830  15  32    0  13
#>  2:             a    1   2 23:59  959  25  32    0  34  668  17  23    0  22
#>  3:             a    1   3 23:59  952  26  30    0  42  511  16  18    0  25
#>  4:             a    1   4 23:59  934  31  35    0  50  359  16  18    0  17
#>  5:             a    1   5 23:59  920  34  37    0  59  211  10  12    0  17
#>  6:             b    1   1 23:59  999   1   0    0   0 1150   2   6    0   2
#>  7:             b    1   2 23:59  995   4   0    0   1 1286  12   9    0  13
#>  8:             b    1   3 23:59  992   5   1    0   2 1433  15  13    0  19
#>  9:             b    1   4 23:59  986   7   4    0   3 1561  22  21    0  36
#> 10:             b    1   5 23:59  970  18   7    0   5 1679  42  32    0  47
#> 11:             c    1   1 23:59 2000   0   0    0   0 2000   0   0    0   0
#> 12:             c    1   2 23:59 1999   1   0    0   0 1999   1   0    0   0
#> 13:             c    1   3 23:59 1999   1   0    0   0 1999   1   0    0   0
#> 14:             c    1   4 23:59 1998   2   0    0   0 1998   2   0    0   0
#> 15:             c    1   5 23:59 1995   2   3    0   0 1995   2   3    0   0

#>  1:           2
#>  2:           1
#>  3:           0
